title: New Renaissance Hotels logo - 'R' with big swoopy foot and sans-serif
content:
Hi folks. Need some help ID'ing the fonts in the new Renaissance Hotels logo. Apologies for the small sample; it's the only one I could get:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141110021243im_/http:/typophile.com/files/br_logo_186x94_4680.gif)

So, any ideas for the sans-serif there? My guess is the 'R' is a custom jobbie, but if anyone could suggest what font it may have started off as (if any), I'd greatly appreciate it.
author: iskippy227

comments.content: It's hard to tell at that size, but the sans could be News Gothic (although the C looks like it's a bit more open)
Y'know, I think you're on to something there. I'll have to mess with the kerning a bit, and both the 'C' and the 'R' look custom, but it's definitely a good place to start. Thanks!

the sans serif below is called oceania, i found it on dafont.com ...

[http://www.dafont.com/oceania.font?nb\_ppp=50&text=RENAISSANCE](http://web.archive.org/web/20141110021243/http:/www.dafont.com/oceania.font?nb_ppp=50&text=RENAISSANCE)

it looks like marriott hotels in general use that font on a lot of their marketing materials.

In the spirit of unbridled creativity,

Troy Vera  
Kingdom Graphics  
 [http://www.kingdomgraphics.biz](http://web.archive.org/web/20141110021243/http:/www.kingdomgraphics.biz/ "http://www.kingdomgraphics.biz")  
Yahoo IM: kingdom\_graphics  
Skype: kingdom\_graphics
Also, I was able to approximate the 'R' using ITC Giovanni as a template. Maybe not perfect, but good enough.
